meanings.sent1: She rejuggles the books on the shelf to make them look neat.
meanings.sent2: After the game, he rejuggles the cards for the next round.
meanings.sent3: The chef rejuggles the ingredients in the recipe to create a new dish.
meanings.sent4: Her mind rejuggles the memories of that special day.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces rejuggle into a new pattern as she rearranges them.

meanings.sent1: He rejuggles his decision after hearing new information.
meanings.sent2: Before finalizing the plan, she rejuggles the details one more time.
meanings.sent3: The student rejuggles his answer when he realizes his mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her perspective rejuggles as she listens to different viewpoints.
meanings.sent5: The scientist rejuggles the data to find a new solution to the problem.

meanings.definition: To juggle or handle something skillfully.
meanings.sent1: The performer rejuggles the balls effortlessly during the show.
meanings.sent2: She rejuggles multiple tasks at work without any mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The magician rejuggles the scarves in a mesmerizing way.
meanings.sent4: His fingers rejuggle the keys on the piano with precision.
meanings.sent5: The juggler rejuggles flaming torches to amaze the audience.
